com.stefanmuenchow.collections
Interface ISmartCollection<E>

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>
All Known Subinterfaces:
ISmartList<E>, ISmartQueue<E>, ISmartSet<E>, ISmartSortedSet<E>
public interface ISmartCollection<E>
extends java.util.Collection<E>

Specifies the operations of all smart collections. Lists, Sets, SortedSets and Queues are collections. Smart maps are specified in the interface ISmartMap. Smart Collections are compatible with the standard Collection interface, but add some functionality to them. They are implemented as simple decorators (see Gang of Four).

Author:
Stefan MÃ¼nchow

Method Detail

find

E find(IPredicate<E> pred)
Seeks a single element based on a predicate. The first element for which the predicate returns true, is returned. If the predicate is false for all elements, null is returned.

Parameters:
pred - Predicate
Returns:
Element or null

filter

ISmartCollection<E> filter(IPredicate<E> predicate)
Retains all elements in the collection for which the predicate is true.

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate
Returns:
Collection containing only elements for which predicate returns true

remove

ISmartCollection<E> remove(IPredicate<E> predicate)
Removes all elements in the collection for which the predicate is true.

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate
Returns:
Collection containing only elements for which predicate returns false

replace

ISmartCollection<E> replace(E seek,
                            E replacement)
Replaces each occurence of an element in the collection with a replacement. The elements are compared by the equals method. If the element is not found in the collection, nothing is done.

Parameters:
seek - Element to be replaced
replacement - Replacement
Returns:
List with replaced elements

replace

ISmartCollection<E> replace(IPredicate<E> predicate,
                            E replacement)
Replaces each element in the collection, for which the predicate returns true, with a replacement. The elements are compared by the equals method. If the predicate evaluates to false for all elements, nothing is done.

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate to identify elements to replace
replacement - Replacement
Returns:
List with replaced elements

map

<R> ISmartCollection<R> map(IUnaryFunction<R,E> function)
Calls a given function for each element in the collection with the element as the one and only parameter. Each element is replaced by the return value of the function and the resulting collection is returned. Changes the original collection.

Parameters:
function - Unary function
Returns:
Altered collection
See Also:
IUnaryFunction

Returns:
A single value

IBinaryFunction

join

java.lang.String join(java.lang.String delimiter)
Calls the toString() method of each element in the collection and intersperses the resulting strings with delimiter. The complete result is returned.

Parameters:
delimiter - String that is inserted between each two elements
Returns:
Resulting string representation

Counts all entries for which the predicate evaluates to true.

Parameters:

Returns:
Number of elements in collection for which predicate is true

exists

boolean exists(IPredicate<E> pred)
Checks if the predicate evaluates to true for any element in the collection. If not, the result is false.

Parameters:
pred - Predicate
Returns:
true / false

forall

boolean forall(IPredicate<E> pred)
Checks if the predicate evaluates to true for all elements in the collection. If not, the result is false.

Parameters:
pred - Predicate
Returns:
true / false

flatten

ISmartCollection<E> flatten()
If the collection contains other collections, then the values of all collections are collected recursively and put into the resulting list. If it is already a "flat" collection, nothing is done. The original list is changed.

Returns:
Flat collection not containing any other collection
